direction.raw_text: . BAR -- NIGHT Heroine stands near Grandpa Beast's head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It must have smelled the blood or something. We buried the body and got back on the main road when...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! Grandpa Beast LANDS on the front hood of the Camaro. Heroine and Hero SCREAM and rev the engine, swerving madly as Grandpa Beast VOMITS on the windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine slams on the breaks. Grandpa Beast slides back, holding onto the grill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandpa Beast tears into the engine through the grill as sparks and smoke shoot out. Heroine jerks the steering wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's how I ended up here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMARO -- NIGHT The car crashes into a ditch, DECAPITATING Grandpa Beast. His head FIRES through the windshield, landing on Heroine's lap. Its snake-like tongue lashes out at Heroine's crotch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to talk about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Para wheels over to a COUNTY MAP on the side wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Para stares intently at the map. Adulterer moves over to the window that has shutters over it, peeking through a hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is silent. Bozo looks around, quickly moving towards Grandpa and Grandma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo saunters off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Para points along the map as he explains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group is silent.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No. It was wild out there. No time to think. We just moved. He didn't leave me. He just ran.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The three from the gas pump are over at the TV station? And you say there's four here, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Heroine) Hey, you lived on a farm, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think they're gone? I haven't heard anything for a while, maybe they're gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As long as it's dark, they're around. They hide, wait for you to drop your guard, and then attack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can you be so sure? You said yourself this started a day ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We? We learned fast? You are all that is left of we. No offense Pocohantas, but I think someone else should play "Chief" tonight. Someone that knows the lay of the land. (beat) Like me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe these things are like locusts or something and only come out for a few days to feed. This could just be a part of their life cycle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody's gotta know something about these things. This stuff just doesn't happen out of the blue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You gotta know somethin', you're old.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Old people know stuff like this. Legends, tall tales, shit like that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Grandma) How 'bout you? Or do I have to get rough?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I throw a stick, will you go away?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Heroine) Hey, where was your farm?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you ever slaughter? Slaughter livestock?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Slaughterhouse run-off used to be drained into piping that ran through the mountains.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Earthquakes often cracked the piping and those flow lines were condemned, but never drained.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What I am saying is... there's a distinct possibility that what we are up against is the result of steady stream of blood and tissue that has been leaking into the caves. And a day ago... something broke out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The first order of business is gettin' a big fuckin' tampon in that cave!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - He peeks out the hole and sees nothing but the dark night. Bartender eyes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BOINK! Papa Beast's claw POKES into his eye. Adulterer JERKS away holding his blood squirting eye socket.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They're probably on to the next buffet by now. There's a retirement home up the road, they'd be easy pickings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm telling you, I don't see a thing --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - The eye sees its owner stumble back and fall to the floor holding his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coach and Trampy move to help Adulterer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eyeball fires into Papa's drooling mega-mouth. SLURP!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A Beast arm BURSTS through the side wall and SNAGS Coach's pants and boxers. He screams and lunges forward. He is BOTTOMLESS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone obeys her command to get in the middle of the room. Belle hands Coach a little menu to cover himself with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trampy holds Adulterer's wounded head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coach heads to the bar. Roadie moves to the map near Para.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roadie nods. Heroine jerks a bottle of booze from Beer Guy and tosses it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss Man, pale and morphine pumped, sits at a table with his foot raised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beer Guy scans the stocked bar wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd turns to face Grandpa and his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandpa holds on to Grandma's hand as he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group looks back to Heroine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trampy pensively stays on her fractured phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo blinks. A little taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bartender hands him The Judge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one budges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bartender moves to the back of the bar, grabbing his machete. At the same moment, Coach emerges from behind the bar in very snug, feminine-looking pink sweat pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine tosses the keys to Bartender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo moves to the staircase. There's blood at the bottom and it gets worse with each step. Bartender and Coach follow. Heroine turns to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tuffy stands, sniffling. She wipes the tears from her eyes, looking tough and resolute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine, Tuffy, Roadie, and Beer Guy all move to the basement. The door creaks open slowly. The group descends.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Everyone stay in the middle of the room! Off the walls! NOW!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, does everyone agree that they are still out there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know some first aid if we have a kit. Do we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the kitchen, under the sink.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one goes anywhere alone. Least of all, unarmed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Coach) There's some sweats in my bag behind the bar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a clever man. (re: Bozo) Why do you take shit from him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, he's an ass, but he's my brother. Que sera-sera.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look man, I read books. He reads bumper stickers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, we need to stay alert and for everyone to take a role. (to Boss Man) You gotta have some guns or weapons around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got my .38 here. That's six shots and two refills. Downstairs, I have locker with a sawed-off and some gardening tools. Maybe a few boxes of shells.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got shells, too. Box and a half tops. Machete behind the bar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So we've got guns, kitchen knives, pipes, fire and sticks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I might be able to do something with the bottles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're gonna need a whole lot more than that to get outta here alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, now you have something to say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You young'uns worry about weapons, I'm thinkin' 'bout strategy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit still, look less like a meal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's for bears and sharks, chunky chew.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, what else do we have? Can we somehow contact the outside world?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't get anybody. I don't even know if I have a signal anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have a CB in my truck, we could get some help out here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who the hell would you call?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you drive a short beer bus or something? You go out there, you get eaten. You stay in here, you get eaten. Anyone comes to help, they get eaten. Don't you see a pattern here, Spuds Makenzie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then I guess we should just give up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: Trampy) Believe me, I'd love to save the day and get some heroic snatch, but it's not in the cards, partner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Boss Man) You said you had a short wave radio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go for it. It's by the far wall. Channel 9 is the emergency frequency.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. I'm heading to the basement for supplies. (to Bozo) And you're going upstairs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So that's how it is? (hands out) Fine! Shotgun, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bartender) You're coming with, portly. 'Cause if I'm attacked, I want a fat man close by.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising from his seat) I'll go with ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you gonna do? Throw your teeth at 'em? Sit down, Cocoon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You! Zorba! You're coming too! (to Heroine) Now gimme the keys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those two will be on the other side waiting for you. If you become food, I don't want the only set of keys in the belly of one of those things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any volunteers to head into the basement with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With what happened upstairs -- TUFFY Shut up! Shut your mouth. You have no idea what is running through me right now. No idea. (to Heroine) I'm ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bozo slightly slips on the blood. He grips the railing and pulls himself up the staircase like an old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They unlock the door, swinging it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bartender has the key in the thick dead bolt, ready to move.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Alright you two, I don't want to hear any of this, "oh, I dropped the key, wrong key, ain't no key here." When I want out, I want out, ok?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bozo hustles in. The door shuts and locks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Bozo is on the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm okay! I'm okay!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo rises and nervously surveys the damaged floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo jumps when he sees the gore and the bloody shoes from Cody's attack. The TV illuminates the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on. Come on. Come on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Geeezzzus. (moving gingerly) Okay, now. Easy steps. Easy breaths. Easy steps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Belle kneels next to the Boss Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls a bottle out of his pocket and hands it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She puts a few drops on his out-stretched tongue.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Morphine. My magic potion. I need a few drops.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should try a little, it'll calm your nerves. Works like a charm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No other time than now, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, before you do that, help me move. There's a small room off the kitchen where I can lay down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But -- BOSS MAN It's much safer in there. Trust me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The basement is dark, dingy and scattered with crap. Dried out ANIMAL CARCASSES hang from the ceiling on hooks. A WINDOW is open. Roadie slams it shut, eyeing the room, staring into the dark corners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tuffy tightly grips her weapon, ready to fire. Heroine kneels next to a hatch door that emits a red glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roadie jams a pipe into the little door, bracing it shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beer Guy finds the dusty locker and opens it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You don't need to know what that is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a sawed-off shotgun in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bartender and Coach have their ears pressed to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind them, through a boarded window, something CRAWLS upward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo moves turtle slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves to the Boss Man's private room. He puts his hand out to open it. Trembling, he touches the knob and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The door eases open. Bozo steps inside the room. He moves over to a lamp and pulls the chain. A bat FLIES off the lamp shade SCREECHING. Bozo falls backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bartender and Coach jump back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo gets off the floor again. He may have filled his pants.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Just a bat! I'm okay! Just a bat!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: If he doesn't shut up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is like a converted pantry. Boss Man lies on a cot, kissing Belle. A tiny wall fan spins providing ventilation. Belle pulls away and brushes back her long hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Belle, a bit high, sways and starts to remove her clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes off her blouse and tosses it at him. She then lifts up her skirt and bends over, giggling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't feel a thing, Hon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a bad girl, aren't you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roadie emerges with two crates. He dumps them on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beer Guy holds a rusted machete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine moves to the stairs, but stops. She grabs Tuffy by the arm and takes her aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine reaches into her shirt and pulls out an IDENTICAL LOCKET as Tuffy's. She opens it and displays a picture of a LITTLE GIRL.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Trust me, I plan on having a full breakdown when this is over, but for now, we all have to be strong, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is my daughter, Charlie. She's all I'm after.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I'm gonna need your strength, every bit of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. But still do me a favor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a wink) Don't tell anyone I have a soft side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bozo turns and points the gun around the room. He sees the CB. It is like an intercom with a cable running outside. He drops the shotgun and fidgets with the CB knobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All he gets is static. A faint GROWL is heard outside. OUTSIDE THE DOOR Bartender hears the growl, his eyes grow wide.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello? Anyone there? We need help out here at the United Nations Tavern. Send guns, tanks, and all that shit. 10-4. S.O.S.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Belle rubs her hands over her rounded ass and flicks her tongue at Boss Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She cringes and backs up a little.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How much you got to see the show?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't understand, sweety. Daddy doesn't pay. Daddy sees the show for free. But you do get points for being horny on a night like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't expect a man to buy a car without a test drive first, can you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um, hmm -- BOSS MAN Now wiggle that sweet little ass over here and sit on Daddy's face, I wanna do some appraising.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bozo barks into the CB.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CB is JERKED from Bozo's hands and slams into the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo aims the gun at the wall. Chewing sounds begin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He backs up to the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Repeat. We need help. SOS. Calling all cars! Calling all cars! We need help at the United Nations Tav --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Okay, I'm ready to come out now! Bartender confidently turns the key. CLICK! It breaks off in the lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !?" WHAT IS "OH?" What does "oh" mean? Bozo knocks on the door hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bartender looks to Coach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! A thunderous CRASH! Boards fly off the wall.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SECOND FLOOR BOZO OPEN THE DOOR

direction.raw_text: Belle, hearing the crash, jerks back from Boss Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Sister Beast #1 and Sister Beast #2 punch through the tiny wall fan and GRAB Belle by the scalp. She is JERKED against the wall. She's slammed against it repeatedly and then -- RIP! Belle's skin is TORN from her head and torso. Boss Man jumps back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Belle falls into Boss Man's arms for a HIDEOUS KISS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss Man shoves the bloody Belle back against the wall. Sister Beast #1 pokes her head inside the room, hissing. MAIN BAR Heroine and the others, just returning from the basement, hear the mayhem from upstairs and the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coach fumbles desperately with the jammed lock, trying to use his fingernails to turn the metal stump.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Great god, why do you damn me?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bozo bangs on the door and looks over his shoulder at the Momma and Papa Beast chomping at the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group is mesmerized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss Man uses the cot to block the Sister Beasts from entering. They hiss and shred the cot fabric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo kicks and punches the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine charges up the staircase. Roadie rips the sawed-off weapon from Beer Guy and runs for the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The key broke off!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine rips the earring from Bartender's ear. He YELPS. She jams the backing into the lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss Man crawls for the door. Sister Beast #1 fires out a whip-like tongue and snags Boss Man's damaged foot. He howls in pain. Sister Beast #2 tongue-lasso's his other foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine's picking fingers are bleeding from her effort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss Man is pulled towards the Sister Beasts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roadie kicks open the door and FIRES at the Sisters. They dive back out of the room screeching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! Right behind Bozo, the boards fly off the portal window. Papa Beast flies at Bozo. Bozo spins and aimlessly FIRES his shotgun, hitting Papa Beast directly in the groin. The door flies open. Bozo is YANKED to safety just as Papa STRIKES the closing door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The patrons track the wild CRASHING and HIGH-PITCHED SHRIEKING sounds of Papa Beast. He finally breaks out of the upstairs. Beer Guy and Roadie carry Boss Man into the room as Coach, Bartender, Heroine and the shaken Bozo creep down the stairs. Bozo slowly takes a seat in his brother's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine glares at Boss Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coach eyes the group, this is his time to shine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long silence. Bozo stares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coach sits down, humbled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is silent. Bartender motions to Boss Man, but he is promptly shushed by Boss Man. Heroine notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine glares at Roadie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roadie nods, causing Boss Man to sigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They clam up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss Man reluctantly pulls out some keys that are on a string around his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coach stands forward.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I thought that was it for a second there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got Papa in the stones. (beat) He's neutered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That back room is sealed shut.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you to stay in the main room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah... I will. I will. Promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising, full of brawn) If they can't reproduce anymore -- we are one step closer! A big step! Now is the time to band together. We need to rise up against these monsters of the night! Those creatures are no match for the human spirit! We can do it! We just need to believe in each other! In all of us! We need to make a stand! Right here! Right now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We know what not to do. We must stay focused and together. The beasts will find a breach. We gotta find a way out before they find a way in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's run for the cars, cause mass confusion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The lot's too damn far, that's surefire suicide.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Roadie) You. What was that door downstairs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It runs about a hundred yards and spits out on the backside of that hill down the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Grass, man. I grow pot down there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does the tunnel spit out near a car?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It spits out behind the parking lot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My truck is near, but it ain't nearly big enough to haul the whole lot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a shot. Is it gassed up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three of us go. Two to defend, one to drive. We back up to the bar and then tear ass out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me make this clear; if we stay, we die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're trusting that con? He'll ditch us and never look back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! I'm not trusting him either, that's why I'm going with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Courage is being scared to death, but saddling up anyway." (off blank stares) The Duke. I will go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is it. They have this place surrounded, but if we go under them we might just make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is a bottleneck waiting to happen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! Bozo SLAPS Coach's ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine takes The Judge from Bartender and hands it to Coach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coach takes the rusty machete from Beer Guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine, Roadie, and Coach move to the basement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three look to Bozo, who offers a parting nod.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This one's great under pressure. I wish you luck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The rest of you prepare the weapons, whatever you got left. 'Cause when we crash through those walls, we're bringin' death with us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I don't believe in guns.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This ain't time for a political stance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This doesn't run out of ammo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When you get to that truck... drive it like you stole it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At a booth, Trampy re-bandages Adulterer's eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo moves close, surveying the bandage work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bozo turns his attention back to Trampy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It serves you right for cheating.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I figure it's karma. You wronged me and you wronged your wife, so this is karma biting you on the ass, or in your case... in the eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could be worse, you could be dead. Then again, the climax is upon us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TUNNEL -- NIGHT The tunnel is thin and no more than SIX FEET HIGH. Cherry red fluorescent lights line the top of the tunnel and kneehigh marijuana plants are along the ground soil. There are thick pipes above the plants that work as a makeshift watering system. There is about six inches of water on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coach bites his lip, dying to say something.

dialogue.raw_text: (to Roadie) You and I are similar. We both have accents. We both travel a lot. We both don't really have homes...

dialogue.raw_text: I am sorry, I ramble when I'm nervous.

dialogue.raw_text: It's just that this seems like the opportune time for someone to be horribly... offed.

dialogue.raw_text: You don't want the rag touching booze, that way you can hold it and ensure it explodes when you throw it.

dialogue.raw_text: You aren't nearly as dumb as you look, are you?

direction.raw_text: sound is heard from above.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roadie and Coach reluctantly turn, leaving Heroine to fend with the Beast. Heroine charges. Hissing, Sister Beast #1 charges as well. Heroine pumps and fires. BOOM! Sister Beast spins, avoiding the shot. Now too close, Heroine jams the Beast in the mouth with the gun, knocking her back. Sister Beast #1 responds with a swipe and chomp on the arm. Heroine bats her away. Sister Beast #1 moves to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roadie and Coach sprint until Sister Beast #2 BURSTS through the tunnel walls, stopping Roadie and Coach in their tracks. Roadie fires his weapon, but it sparks and fizzles.

direction.raw_text: With the two Beasts closing in. The men are trapped. Coach looks around, seeing a plan.

direction.raw_text: Heroine sees what he's doing, sprints back the way they came. As the two Beasts charge, Coach pulls himself out of the water by holding onto the above piping. He's forced to wait for Heroine to get out of the water. The second she does, he jams the cord into the water.

dialogue.raw_text: They're trying to burrow through the tunnel walls.

dialogue.raw_text: Grab onto ceiling and get out of water!

Teen Beast madly rips floor boards away, moving towards Para's table. Teen Beast bursts through the floor, knocking Para to the floor. Para crawls to his fallen wheelchair. Teen Beast spots him, moves in to feed. Para points his seat back at the scattered .38 bullets and flips the armrest switch. SNAP! The bullets jump to the power magnet. Para yanks one free, loads the pistol and turns just as Teen Beast strikes...

With her hair stuck in Papa Beast's claw, Tuffy is pulled face to face with the beast. She squirms as he chomps at her, but with no front teeth, he can't do immediate damage.

Papa Beast struggles to get free, but the others hold tight. Papa Beast's body begins to quiver from a lack of oxygen. His eyes widen, face to face with Tuffy.

direction.raw_text: Momma Beast falls back, knocking down Heroine. Momma Beast nearly falls out, but manages to grab the rear gate with one claw. Defenseless, Heroine backs away. Momma Beast holds on tightly, pulling herself onto the bed of the truck. Tuffy stares back through the glass, unable to do anything. Momma Beast lunges towards Heroine. Momma Beast's claw snags Heroine's locket, jerking Heroine right up to the creature's face. The locket catches Momma's attention for split second. Her remaining eye goes from the picture of Charlie to Heroine. Momma's mouth opens wide. Heroine screams! And then, a beam of the RISING SUN catches the gold locket and burns into Momma's eye. In one quick motion, she's gone, taking the locket with her. Heroine lets out her breath, reaching around her neck for what is no longer there. The truck SKIDS to a halt. Tuffy jumps out.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're safe until dark, but we need to find other people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know where the IGA grocery store is over in Red Mountain?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! The lighter springs out, hot. Heroine lights up and passes one to Tuffy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moment of silence as Adulterer and Tuffy look down the desolate road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tuffy nods, affectionately touching his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car peels off. Adulterer watches the car tear down the road. He glances up at the RISING SUN.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't wanna go home alone... I don't wanna see what might have...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry about that. Just go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry about your son. I really am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're going to get my little girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TOWN ROAD -- DAY A sign reading "RED MOUNTAIN" swings lazily in the breeze. Tuffy and Heroine coast down a town road. There are random POOLS OF RED BLOOD in the dirt. No one in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN ROAD -- DAY Adulterer drives along a small town road. There's no sign of life here either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEROINE'S GRANDMOTHER'S HOUSE -- DAY The car pulls up to the house. The only sound is the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine and Tuffy look at each other and proceed with caution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ADULTERER'S CAR -- DAY He pulls up in front of his house. The front door is swinging open, BANGING against the door frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEROINE'S GRANDMOTHER'S HOUSE -- DAY Heroine enters the ransacked house. Tuffy follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ADULTERER'S HOUSE -- DAY He enters his house. It too, is a mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEROINE'S GRANDMOTHER'S HOUSE -- DAY They look down the stairs to the basement. Nothing. They move up the stairs to the second floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! They spin to the noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ADULTERER'S HOUSE -- DAY He moves up the stairs to the master bedroom. SMACK! There's a noise at the end of the hall. SMACK!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEROINE'S GRANDMOTHER'S HOUSE -- DAY They cautiously move to the last room in the hall. A scratched, closed door without an outside handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine kicks in the door and... There's a note on a teddy beer that says, "WE WENT TO THE SHELTER. LOVE GRANDMA AND CHARLIE."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shudders SMACK against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ADULTERER'S HOUSE -- DAY Adulterer holds a shattered PICTURE of his wife and two kids. He sighs and puts it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun shines bright in the cloudless sky. There is a stiff wind that stirs up the dust. Bartender's car slowly lurches up the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine and Tuffy skeptically look at the surroundings. HEROINE It's right up there, in the back of the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car pulls up in the back of the store and stops. They get out, looking around. Tuffy holds a machete. Adulterer kneels against his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adulterer shakes his head, acknowledging their death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adulterer sheepishly nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group makes their way to the store front, peeking beyond the glass doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the distance, in middle of a dusty parking lot, CHARLIE stands staring at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine runs to her and the others follow. Charlie fidgets awkwardly. She cries and blood stains her dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Heroine nears, Adulterer GRABS her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group eyes Charlie, noticing Heroine's locket around her ankle, leading to a slightly ajar manhole cover. Suddenly, the sunlight starts to FADE. They look up the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MOON moves in front of it -- a SOLAR ECLIPSE. Beast HISSING and FLUTTERING is heard. Heroine looks from left to right, panic stricken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sunlight is fading. The manhole cover shakes, something is holding Charlie in place. Heroine lurches forward, but Adulterer holds her at bay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At a standstill, the group looks around for options. In the distance, the darkness of the eclipse rolls towards them. Adulterer reacts, grabbing Tuffy's machete and lunging for Charlie. The strike cuts the chain at her ankle. The manhole cover POPS off and a Beast claw sinks into Adulterer. The darkness covers the manhole. Momma Beast rises, hoisting Adulterer's blood dripping body from the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine scoops up her child, moving away from Momma Beast. Tuffy grabs them both, leading them back towards the store front. As Adulterer's blood flows, Momma Beast drags him towards her main prey. A blanket of darkness leads Momma Beast, overtaking the survivors. At the store front, Heroine pulls Charlie close. HEROINE (a whisper) I love you...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, I just got here. Did you find your girl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's supposed to already be here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This place is a ghost town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A string of ten WHITE VANS come to a halt in the dusty parking lot. THE MAN IN TAN (45, buzz cut, leathery skin, cool) steps from the lead van and surveys the ravaged small town. A swarm of men emerge from the other vehicles, all dressed alike in work boots, gas masks and coveralls. They go into action honing in on rubble with SENSORS and COUNTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (27, horn-rimmed glasses, all business) eyes a laptop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Man in Tan closes his eyes in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Man in Tan moves to a few men standing over a pool of blood and guts. Using the sensor equipment, the COMPANY MAN follows the blood trail that enters the grocery store.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty miles. Red Mountain, surrounding farms, local TV studio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many picked up the broadcast?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll have figures within the hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the California high desert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get what you need to sell it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The place is torn to hell. Dust and soot hangs in the air. The men instinctively raise their high-powered rifles, letting the flashlights on the ends lead the way. They follow the trail of blood to a back FREEZER LOCKER. It's scratched, bashed and thrashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Company Man #2 steps forward and uses a metal-cutting chainsaw to cut through the hinges. The door falls with a THUD. As the dust clears, Tuffy, Heroine and Charlie stare back at the men, huddled together in a defensive stance. The Man in Tan creaks his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine, holding Charlie, lurches back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Man in Tan steps forward, guiding the group out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're not safe, she's still alive, she'll be back...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Relax. We know. We're the calvary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A bulky security truck pulls up. A DRIVER, holding a bloody rag to his nose, gets out and moves to the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Driver nods to the back of the truck, opening the door. Bozo lurches out, handcuffed and chained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shirtless, irate BOZO sits next to Grandpa and Grandma in the back. He settles at the sight of the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine covers her daughter's ears as the survivors are helped into the truck. Tuffy sits, looking to Bozo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heroine, last in the truck, turns to the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door shuts on Heroine's concerned face. The Man in Tan locks eyes with the Driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Driver nods back. Sinister implication understood. The Man in Tan lights a cigarette as he watches the truck drive off. The truck's logo reads, "FARM-AID." He inhales. Freeze on him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get these cuffs off me! I'm a goddamn hero for Christ's sake!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for waitin' for me back there, really fuckin' appreciate it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I found a new weak spot on 'em, but it damn ain't pretty getting to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A trauma center. We have doctors waiting. (off Heroine's pause) You're in good hands now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do it quick and spread the mess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: TO LAY GROUNDWORK FOR SEQUEL LIFE EXPECTANCY

direction.raw_text: : THE MAN IN TAN AGE: 45 OCCUPATION: HE CAN'T TELL YOU PURPOSE: TO LAY GROUNDWORK FOR SEQUEL LIFE EXPECTANCY: PRETTY F-ING GOOD The Man in Tan exhales a gust of smoke.
direction.name: direction
